page.title: 05WILDLIFE (2)
page.content:
Birds of prey - the{kestrel}and the {sparrowhawk}- are quite common and increasing in numbers. The{tawny owl, the{barn owl}and the{little owl}are heard but seldom seen.
The{red-legged partridge}is now more plentiful than the older established {common grey partridge.} Breeding locally are{curlew, woodcock, snipe, {heron, red shank, water rail}and {kingfisher.} All three{woodpeckers}are resident, as are the{nuthatch, spotted {fly catcher, tree creeper, gold crest, {turtle dove, warblers, tits, finches, {wren, robin, sparrows,}etc. and, in summer,{swallows, swifts}and{cuckoos.
Other common birds include{pheasants, {Canada geese, wood pigeons, magpies, and all members of the{crow family.
